content.description: Start using a bad undercling up to a large jug above the first bolt. The route slowly wonders to the right slightly and ends at chain anchors. You can lower through a gap in the trees without swinging back to the start.
content.location: Located on the deception ledge. First route as you are coming across the ledge besides the two 5.13s.

content.description: Underture can be found on Deception ledge just left of the large tree. Look for two closely spaced vertically oriented anchor bolts. Tie your belayer in and blast off. Thoughtful moves. A little spicier than is typical E38 routes.

Standing by the railing, the first two bolts are almost at head level.  Scramble down under the trestle from the east.  Tricky moves ease up before reachng the anchors at the base of Underture and Overture.  Underhanded can be toproped from this ledge with an exposed move to the chains.

With a rescrubbing and maybe some chalk marks, this would get another star.  The complete "Underhanded Overture" is a big pitch.
content.location: The first route behind the railing along the Main Wall, just past the water drip.  It is easiest to belay down in the hollow below the railing.

content.description: This route is high quality rock with solid if not sometimes slick rock. The climbing is blocky with good stances for rest and easy clips. More or less sustained for the grade. Belay your partner up and sit at the anchor for a while to enjoy the view.
content.location: There is a trail leading to start of this route at the NE end of the concrete bridge.

content.description:
this is the far left route starting right off railroad grade

Burdo said this was intended to be a 10a, but some holds broke.
content.location: left end of wall, you could continue to ledge above to access Late for Dinner or Just Desert

content.description:
Long Route, needs 2 ropes to rappel, or climb to midway chains.

Chossy.
content.location: Between Jiffy Pop and The End.

content.description:
Overture is a continuation of either Happy Black or The Underture. Climbs through roof above those anchors.

I remember liking the roof with some wild stemming.
content.location: This is listed as 1 pitch starting from the ledge above RR grade, but can be climbed with newer routes below from below the bridge as a long pitch or 2 pitch.

content.description:
This route has been incorrectly called Wild Goat, fyi. Old Milwaukee Road is what the FA called it.

From the east end of the concrete bridge climbs up and slightly right on easy terrain. Reach left to clip a bolt at head height then do a airy maneuver to the left to gain positive holds. Straight up from there leads to a left trending somewhat chossy corner/chimney with three very closely space bolts. I was able to rap it with a 60M .

Awesome, well-protected first 10a route for all ages. The crux is right at the big block, but a big jug awaits to get you out.
content.protection: 14 bolts, new permadraw anchors. It's possible to backclean a few draws.
content.location: Starts just before the dropoff below the bridge, underneath the obvious cornern and left of Jiffy Pop.

content.description: Relatively easy moves off the ledge. Turns into a fun technical face climb that eases up towards the top.
content.location: This is the route furthest left off Bandit Ledge. Follow the dirt trail up from the Iron Horse trail to the upper portion of Deception Wall-Left.

content.description: Techy face climbing up to a nice ledge. Then pull through jugs for 4 more bolts. Originally this climb went straight up from the bolt on the ledge, bouldery, but now most people wander a bit left to a  big dirty jug.
content.location: Between Derailed, and Old Milwaukee. Look up for the big roof.

content.description: Start on the right side of the ledge. Follow a crack up a slightly overhanging corner.
content.location:
This is the route on the right on the ledge above Side Dish.

You can reach the start of this route by climbing Side Dish or by a trail just left of Deception Wall.

content.description:
A good 5.7 that may be challenging for a new leader.

It provides the access to Rat Face above.
content.location: starts at east end of bridge, where the wall drops off to the void under the bridge,  traverses to the right to end on top of small buttress.

content.description: From the top anchors of Rat Face, climb onto a dirty sloping ledge and trend right towards a small cave with a bird nest in it.  Clip the first bolt from the ledge and climb straight up through a very hard crux on micro crimps.  After the crux, route eases significantly to anchors.  A one move wonder of a climb but worth doing for the exposure alone!
content.location: This is a third pitch to Jiffy Pop and Rat Face.  To lower, find the anchors directly below the route which are separate from the Rat Face anchors.  Either lower from these, or make the sketchy, dirty traverse back to the Rat Face anchors.  A single 60m rope will take you to the trestle from either anchor.

content.description: Steep face climbing with crux start.
content.protection: 7 bolts including anchor, from the upper ledge.
content.location: furthest left on upper ledge ( or can be reached from below the bridge from one of the newer routes.

content.description: Starts on the left side of Deception Wall. Climbs up very easy (5.7?) terrain to reach an intermediate 2-bolt anchor. Traverse right 10ft to a bolt with a short chain. Pull some burly moves through 20ft of overhanging and somewhat broken rock.
As per Bryan : Short and Savage, crux making clips, first   5.13 by Mike Orr
content.location: Far right end of Deception, scramble up slimy slab to ledge left bolted overhanging wall, right bolt line is another 13 project

content.description:
face climb, run-out start.

I GUESS THIS ROUTE NO LONGER EXISTS.
content.location: right of Side Dish, left of new route that starts at edge of east end of bridge.

content.description: A straightforward less-than-vertical climb on blocky rock.
content.location: This route is the 2nd from the left at the base of the Deception wall.
